@ bernard90
Download VLAN Media Player (aka VLC Media Player) and install it... When finishing that, you'll have to give the .sub-file the same name as the movie... Example: The.Bourne.Ultimatum[2007]DvDrip[Eng]-aXXo.avi
Then u rename the subtitle file to:
The.Bourne.Ultimatum[2007]DvDrip[Eng]-aXXo.sub

After that just start VLC Media Player and enjoy the movie !! It should work now (;

Get DVD Flick, which is free, or ConvertxToDVD and convert the AVI to a DVD that will play in your standalone player. Nero Vision can do that too. There are a billion guides available. Check Afterdawn(dot)com.

DoobieX, its very simple to put some subtitles on it yourself. Go to www.ondertitel.com, look for the film, there's probably an aXXosubtitlefile there or else just try some subtitles and see if it fits in the film (time).. Just put the film and the subtitle file in the same map and give it the same name et voilà. That's it (but don't forget when you change the name to put .avi and .srt after it or else you'll get some message that it can damage the film blablablah)
